name: Salad of Shredded Greens and Smoked Salmon (Chiffonnade de Saumon)
description: DURING the last year or so, chiffonnades - greens and vegetables cut into thin slivers - have become increasingly popular, as salads appear more often on menus. At Auberge des Templiers, in Beziers, in the Languedoc region, a chiffonnade of watercress and raw mushrooms was paired with tiny marinated red mullet and monkfish. This recipe comes from Christiane Massia of L'Aquitaine. The dressing can be made a day in advance, then refrigerated, but prepare the rest of the ingredients just before serving time.
keywords: crème fraîche, lettuce, smoked salmon, summer
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup creme fraiche or sour cream
1 head Boston lettuce, rinsed and dried
4 thin slices smoked salmon, cut into wide strips

recipeInstructions.text: In small bowl, combine creme fraiche or sour cream, lemon juice and paprika.
Stack several lettuce leaves and, using long chef's knife, cut into fine strips, as if slicing cabbage for cole slaw. Place in large salad bowl and toss with dressing.
Distribute lettuce among 4 salad plates and cover each with several strips of salmon. Serve immediately.
